titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Bookplates by Vytautas O. Virkau
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Molly E. Dotson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:03

did.unittitle: Collection of Bookplates by Vytautas O. Virkau
did.abstract: The collection contains 121 unused bookplate specimens designed by Vytautas O. Virkau, including ex-libris for both individual and institutional patrons.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Bookplates by Vytautas O. Virkau, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Vytautas O. Virkau was born in Lithuania in 1930. He studied in Munich, Germany, from 1946-1949 and moved to the United States in 1951. He attended the University of Chicago and the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, where he earned an MFA in 1956. He was a professor at several Chicago-area colleges and also very active in the Lithuanian émigré community. In addition to being a prolific bookplate artist, having designed nearly 400 ex-libris for both individual as well as institutional patrons, Virkau is also a painter and book illustrator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 121 bookplate specimens designed by Vytautas O. Virkau, including ex-libris for both individual and institutional patrons.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Bookplates – Individuals. II. Bookplates – Institutions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the patron's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains bookplates designed by Virkau for individuals.
